name: Khartoum Youth Hostel - YHA
description: Camping and dorms in the secure grounds of the  YHA –  basic facilities and close to a number of nice restaurants.

name: Meroe Pyramids bush camp
description: A highlight of our trip to Sudan, there is a great spot to bushcamp here

name: Bush camp
description: In open field.

name: Bush camp
description: Naast Taka Mountains bij meertje met watervogels en grazende beesten.  Af en toe komt een herder of een ezeltje voorbij. Next to Taka Mountains near lake with water birds and grazing animals. From time to time a shepherd or donkey passes by. In the morning there were over 100 drinking camels.

name: Bush camp
description: In open field under trees. Very quiet.

name: Bush camp
description: In the middle of the desert.

name: Public parking
description: Behind homes in hamlet. Much interest of villagers.

name: Bush camp
description: In the middle of the desert.

name: among palm trees
description: Between palmeries at the outskirts of Karima. This was the only place in Sudan where we had discussion about our camping location with locals.

name: Public parking
description: Beach next to boulevard. A bit busy because of picnicers.

name: Wild Camp Nile
description:
Bush camp at the Nile in the past?
I couldn’t find a spot there

name: Wild camp 3rd Cataract
description: In a palm grove. (The difficulty we found in camping along the Nile is getting down to the palm groves over generally 2m high irrigation ditches)? But not a bad spot despite the continued 45°C heat day and night – and some local farmers who came to chat were very welcoming.

name: Bush Camp
description: On the banks of the Nile & secluded

name: Bush Camp
description: Secluded and view over pyramids & river

name: Sudan National Camp Resort
description: Loud mosque, best option in town

name: Acropole Hotel
description: Nice hotel where they can help you with visa registration, travel permit and everything

name: Refill Gas Station
description: If you need to refill your gas bottle you can do it here in this refilling gas station

name: Refill Gas Station
description: You can refill your cooking gas bottle (propane/gpl). Located on the left hand side on the road from gedaref to Khartoum

name: Filling Gas Station
description: Possibility to refill your propane bottle (cooking gas)

name: German guesthouse
description:
looks closed ....



The BEST OPTION in Khartoum for Overlanders. Norbert the German manager and his very kind team will do everything for you to facilitate and make your stay enjoyable. Nothing idiom possible for them and you will definitely appreciate their advices and great contacts to help you to obtain visas, permits or simply organize a tourism tour in Sudan. Norbert offers 3 packages that suit perfectly the Overlanders needs : Package#1: for $20pp/day you get a all inclusive package including showers, full pension, unlimited laundry, wifi, swimming pool and pickup at the airport, soft drinks. Sleeping in you car in the street (secure). Package #2: for the Overlanders sleeping in their car you can park outside in the calm, safe and night watched street in front of the guesthouse for $10 per car and you get access to water electricity, swimming pool and wifi. Package #3: A room for $80 a night, sleeps 2 and is all inclusive as package #1. Be generous to support this marvelous oasis in the heart of Khartoum. On top you can benefit from the laundry facilities for only 1€/kg!!! We stayed 1 week (package 2) and thanks to Norbert and his staff we really enjoyed our time in Khartoum despite our administrative race to get visa for Saudi Arabia  To contact Norbert Zschornak +249903306718 reservation@germanguesthouse.com

name: Small road through farm land
description: off main road, light ppl traffic, those that did pass were friendly, lots of herding in surrounding area, quiet

name: Palm Trees Camp
description: Just beside Nile river. It's a quiet bush camp at the end of small village. Perfect to take a rest for couple of day

name: Nile Wild camp
description: Wild camp with access to the water and wide shadow provide by dates palm trees

name: Naga Tempel dessert wild camp
description: near the Naga tempels a wild camp in the dessert. Very quiet!

name: Dessert wildcamp
description: in the middle of the dessert, wildcamp on our way to Kassala

name: Nile Bank
description: Wonderful place for birdwatching with access to Nile not far from Barge

name: Dry River Bank
description: Nice and quiet place to stay overnight. River empty during dry season, probably full during wet season, which will create a nicer spot to bivouac

name: Dinder National Park Border
description: Wild camp near Dinder National Park

name: Petroleum Company
description: We could camp between the first and second security gate. Police everywhere so very safe. We had to camp here because Moroe was flooded! Don't camp at Moroe during rainy season :)

name: Nubian Guesthouse
description: Nice guesthouse in Abri right on the Nile river. You can camp on the street in front.  Quiet and safe.  Owner Magzoub is very helpful and friendly. You can either book a room for 250 SDG single room-300 SDG double room or just use shower and toilet for a donation. You can even swim in the Nile.

name: Soleb Guest House
description: Guest house run by a friendly old man. Rooms are available but camping in front of the house is also possible  (for free), though he might insist on you taking a room anyway, out of sheer hospitality. In walking distance from the beautiful Soleb temple.

name: Park ranger
description: The GPS location to this is wrong. It is further back away from the border about 10 km or so. There are two huts where the park rangers stay. If you are really stuck they will let you stay but only really if you won't make it across the border in time or tell them you feel uncomfortable camping at the border  (we only had a tent). We stayed here as the other two spots listed here are too exposed.

name: Quiet spot off dirt road
description:
Nice quiet spot on dirt road about 200m from highway
Passed by a couple of locals who said hello but didn't stop for more
Only problem- loads of flies and not much shade, ground was very hot!

name: Foreigner permit
description: Get your Foreigner Permit right of the departure terminal. Bring a passport photo, copy of your passport photo page and a photocopy of your visa plus a letter written from your accommodation (they will know what to do). Cost 530£. After you have this don't forget to get your "photo and travel permit", see the POI on iOverlander just east of the airport. I had a two week transit visa with an extra stamp saying I had to do this on the border or here in Khartoum.

name: Foreigners Permit (Option 2)
description: The main office to get your foreigners permit. If you can go to the airport office go and get it there, here you wait a long time and have to go from nondescript office to nondescript office struggling to keep sane. Photocopy of your passport photo page, your visa and one passport photo. Cost was 370€. Good luck...

name: Amir hotel
description: Basic hotel, with fan, bathroom inside the room and squat toilet. 250S£/night for 2 people. Friendly owner.

name: Palace hotel
description:
So so Hotel in Port Sudan                                                   Good location
AC works

name: Suakin
description: Parking behind fish market. When we were there it was not used. Plenty of space and a nice view on the old city and the harbor. Quiet place, though at 21:00 there was some modern music played somewhere.

name: Wild Camping
description: Quiet place hidden away.

name: Nubian Lodge/Guesthouse
description: This is a very luxurious hotel with 150 usd rooms. BUT: you can shower here for free! They have a separate shower/toilet block near the side gate. Ask at the reception for the caretaker and explain that you are an overlander who would like to use the shower. Enjoy :)

name: AlMotwakil Hotel
description: Hotel quite clean. Restaurant. Secure parking at the back for motorbikes. Expensive at US$90/S£600 a night for twin room with no towels. If you've exchanged your US$$ on black market then it makes it a lot cheaper.

name: Imperial Hotel
description: It has lost its grandeur and it's a bit grubby in places but is ok for Sudan. Twin room S£400. A bit pricey unless you're using black market exchange rate. Restaurant. Safe parking for motorbikes.

name: Amazing wild camp site
description:
Amazing wild campsite along railway desert track, about 125km out of Wadi Halfa.

Easy to drive track passing deserted stations. 

Stunning campsite amongst mountains, in a sandy gully so protected and hidden from the winds.

name: Fish restaurant
description: Don't know what the name is in Arabic, but a helpful local lead us to this restaurant with little air conditioned huts set around a courtyard. We had fried Perch accompanied by fresh herbs, onion, bread and a hot sauce. One of the most satisfying meals I've had in a long time.

name: Parking near Cleopatra Hotel
description: Overnight parking and use of showers and toilet for a courtesy gift (10-20 SDP)

name: Alien registration office
description:
In this office you can register (within three days of entry) as an "alien".
You need a copy of your passport, of your entry visa and a passfoto. Copyshops are around the corner. Cost here: 521 SDP

name: Fixer for KSA visa
description:
Location of office of Waleed in Khartoum. Very reliable! Phone +249 91 235 3377. 
 
Only sign in Arabic. Next to Sky tours Travel. 

This us what you need to apply:
passport and copy, two photos with white background, original carnet de passage, copy marriage certificate(for women) copy of car registration and copy driver license.

name: Quiet spot on dirt road
description: Watch out for thorns on the ground and mud if it rains. Really sticky mud! But it was quite and no one showed up!

name: Police Station for Registration
description: You have to register(copies are done here), 780 SDG for 2

name: Mohamed Fixer in Suakin
description:
This is a fixer (driving a black Mercedes) to make arrangements for the ferry from Suakin to Jeddah. 

He gives a fair price, but that is where is services end!!! 

He does NOT keep agreements; 
- we agreed he would guide us in the port, but at the last minute he sends an associate.
- agreed to leave at noon and changes it last minute to 13.00PM! 
- Then his associate shows up saying let's leave later as I want to pray! But he agreed to 13.00PM just two hours before...a muslim forgot he needs to pray, yeah right! 
- his associate does NOT explain anything! Wonders off without letting you know what is going on, etc.
- goes to pray for 1 hour without saying anything!
- his associate does NOT speak any English not even a few words!!!! Immigration asked questions that he could NOT translate to us. And someone else had to translate for us. Why are we paying our fixer again? 
But Mohamed said he spoke good English. 
- his associate also did NOT want to work and just pointed out queues without telling what to get where. Only after our insistence and multiple calls to his boss did he actually start doing his job! 

So Mohamed LIED many times to us, leaving us a very unsatisfactory with his services. 

I DO NOT RECOMMEND HIM! 

Rather use the fixer below (same price range): 
Willy. Ahmad A Magid
donyamanga@yahoo.com
+249 91 231 0548

name: Willy Amad A. Mahid fixer Sawakin
description:
We recommend you use this fixer and NOT Mohamed (driving a Mercedes). 

Responds fast to emails, offers fair price. We choose differently because he would be in Egypt on the day of our departure and could not lead us through the harbor (immigration and customs). 

We were extremely disappointed in Mohamed as he lied a lot to us (see other review)!!!!

Contact details: 
Willy. Ahmad A Magid
donyamanga@yahoo.com
+249 91 231 0548

name: Motor Mart Co
description: The whole area does Toyota. These guys speak good english and sell parts. They found us a good mechanic.

name: New Ministry of Tourism and Wildlife office
description: The office you need for the photo permit is on the 2nd floor.

name: Nubian Hotel
description: Lovely new hotel. Clean shared ablutions. Friendly staff. And aircon in all rooms!! We slept inside for 350 sudanese pounds for a double room.

name: The Blue Nile Sailing Club
description:
Blue Nile Sailing Club

The place is a bit run down but it's still a great campingspot.

With a rooftop tent you can sleep on the big and secured parkinglot. 
If you have a seperate tent you can camp in the grassy kindergarten alongside the Nile.
The place is very quiet at night and around 1 AM all the lights go off.

What makes this place worthwhile are the clean bathrooms(ask them to open the new ones, not the one of the mosque) and great cold showerpressure as well as the friendly and helpful staff.

There is a fruit juice stand(SP. 25,-for a deliciously fresh banana with milk and sugar shake), a small shop with cold drinks (SP.5,- per small bottle) on the parkinglot as well and a small "restaurant"/kitchen(owner is Willem) that opens in the evening and sells foul(mashed beans).

Price is USD5,- pppn and USD10,- per car per night. Although if you sleep in a rooftop tent it might be less.

Phone: 0912569563 of Muhammed the receptionist.

With in the club. There's camping for tourists. The club is located on the nile coast. Price per person. 5$. And also per the car is 5$ And per bus our trucks. Is 10$ And motorcycle is 3$. And Children under fifteen years free. It's very close to national museum and The Forum of the Nile. And downtown. You can go to all those places. Where you don't need a taxi you can woken. The light closes at 12pm. distinguished by quite and safely. You will find everything you looking for. If you want to Inquires before. Inquiry number +249912569563. 0912569563.

name: Metemma border Ethiopia/Sudan
description:
correct location is on the right if coming into Ethiopia. 
Dutch citizens without a Carnet de Passage.

The only country in Africa where we ordered a Carnet for USD250,-(only payable in USD) beforehand with Midhat Mahir(+249 9122 53484, available on Whatssap, we highly recommend him) in Khartoum.

It is impossible to cross the border without, so we've been told by customs at the border.

A colleague of Midhat Mahir awaited us a few km in front of the border to hand us the Carnet de Passage and we were good to go.

Ethiopian exit:
Ethiopian customs are at the right side in a few small containers. They will check your TIP and car and will keep the TIP. After that there's immigration in a small container across the road, after passing the fence.  You'll get an easy stamp out.

Sudanese enter:
Before being able to pass the security guard you have to show your Carnet.
Then you can pass and go to immigration on the left hand side where you already see benches and people sitting. Go inside, they'll need a passportcopy and a copy of your Sudanese visa. Then you have to fill out a small form and they stamp you in.

After immigration you drive further to where you can see 'customs' painted on a white wall. Park your car and enter the big building in the back.Y ou have to walk to the building in the back and then walk all the way to the back of the building and just call around until somebody answers. 
They'll check the Carnet and your car, will take a while to copy and put a signature etc. they'll ask the end destination(never say 'Israel'!). 

After that you'll get a paper that you'll have to hand over to customs when exiting the country.

The Carnet you also have to hand back to Midhat Mahir('s colleagues) when exiting, otherwise he has to pay a fine!(which already happened to him so he was a bit reluctant with helping us)
And that is that!

For any questions about the Carnet you can email us: shakuramj@gmail.com or mij.name.is.nobody@gmail.com

name: Sawakin port immigration, ferry to Saudi Arabia
description:
Dutch citizens without a Carnet de Passage.

The same Midhat Mahir(+249 9122 53484, available on Whatssap, we highly recommend him) in Khartoum that helped us getting a Carnet de Passage for Sudan, helped us with arranging a fixer(Oemar) in Sawakin to border the ferry.

Midhat forwarded our passport copies and carnet copy to our fixer Oemar and gave us his number. In the 2 days we drove up from Khartoum to Sawakin, Oemar already arranged our ferry tickets.

Exiting Sudan:
When arriving in Sawakins port we called Oemar and he arrived within 10 minutes to help us. He needed our passports and carnet, explained a little bit and was on his way very quick and fast. After 3 hours we could drive up to the ferry and handed over the Sudanese carnet to Oemar so he would send it back to Midhat.

You have to leave the car key in the car for the drivers to drive the car in and out of the ferry(nothing was stolen).

The ferrytickets for 2 people incl. the car and Oemar's services costed us SP.4600,- 

We were happy with the service of both Midhat and Oemar. We advice to book a fixer via Midhat, as you'll know for sure you will not be disappointed and arrange a fixed price.

Entering Saudi:
We arrived around 10AM and left the ferry 11AM to go through immigration very easily. No need to fill out a form.

After that the waiting for customs began; after 2 hours there were 2 men that handed over port clearance papers(SR. 270,- but you can pay in USD and can also exchange USD with them if no other option) with which you'd be able to arrange a TIP(free) and insurance(min. a week for SR.140,-). After arranging all the paperwork we had to wait another 3.5 hours for the cars to finally be cleared. From that moment on it goes very fast; they drive up your car and you can check real quick before you get in and drive off.

name: Something in Arabic
description: Nice local restaurant with picture menu and prices in English numbers. We got egg rolls and coffee for breakfast. Tree to park under shade and quiet for people not traffic. Petrol station about 400 m away.

name: Far Best Automotive Service +249912304675
description: Abdu salaam is a very helpful guy who will go out of his way to help you with anything. We found a series of great reviews about him on Horizon blog and they weren't wrong. We also slept in his yard where there's is a toilet and shower although very basic (room with bucket) for free. He found a doctor for my girlfriend to see at his house and we even stayed one night with his family and ate his wife's delicious food. Highly recommended for basic mechanics. We got our brakes done, an oil change, air con regased and a new ignition.

name: Awlad Mubarak
description: Great mechanic knows his land cruiser engines very well if you need any serious work he's your man. +249912366978

name: Olla hotel
description: The real Olla hotel is located in a quiet part of town. Parking for cars is on the street under the tree but the bikes were allowed to stand behind the gate in the tiny courtyard. Paid SP250 for a double bed room. Basic hotel, hard bed and no WiFi. We were here during the riots on December and this part of town was quiet. The big hotel had had it’s windows smashed the day before so we didn’t feel safe there. According to a local 2 people died here on Friday on the bridge after clashes between the rioters and the police. There was a curfew imposed on the city starting at 19:30. We didn’t notice much of this until our friend told us. Stay safe!

name: Merowe Land Tourist Village
description: Great place with hot showers at a very reasonable 800 to 1000 Sudanese Pounds a night. Good place for a break from camping!

name: Syrian Castle Restaurant
description: Good food and value in downtown, with lots of menu choices. Dinner options for 40-90sp.

name: Regency Hotel
description:
Nice local business class 3-4 star hotel in central location. We paid $55 for a much needed comfy double with breakfast when booked thru Moez +249912972571 WhatsApp. (normally $120). Payment in dollars.

By African standards (not ZA), it's a really nice place. 

Parking in front of hotel, next to police booth.

BTW, Moez also helped with Letter of Intro for visa in Addis, and stepped in when we had delays because of our US passports.

name: Several LR / Toyota Parts Shops
description: There are several parts shops and mechanics on this street. For LR, call 0912-340-898

name: Blanco's Defender Workshop
description: Installed master brake cylinder. shop full of defenders. no sign in front.

name: food options
description: good stopping place to eat. lots of stalls

name: Private Bush Camping
description:
Away from the pyramids, away from the road noise, away from the people selling stuff, all alone and very safe. Just to the east of the hotel and north of the pyramids, out of sight and very private. Beautiful stargazing. FREE

They wanted $20 pp for pyramids, or 300 pp.  We got 300sp for both, but it took some effort. Amazing at sunset. 

4 hour drive from Khartoum

name: Chicken & Juice  Place
description: Good BBQ chicken and fresh juice. We split 1 order of chicken which was plenty for 2, 100sp + drinks. Very friendly people.

name: A big hotel with grand entrance
description:
ADMIN NOTE (21-3-2018): now with correct coordinates

Feels like you're entering the grounds of a palace. Multi story beige hotel at south end of town with big rooms, elevator, ceiling fan, and secure parking. 200sp double, very basic

name: Land Rover spare parts
description:
A rare workshop/spare parts shop selling Land Rover spare parts.
Contact: Ali Gomaa Balal 
Mobile: 0912733477
Landline: +249/23006552

name: Blue building cafeteria
description: Lunch/foodstop, chicken, eggs, falafel and baklava. Owner speaks a little English. Basic but good and cheap.

name: Fixers - Mazar and Jamel
description:
Fixer - you can do without, but worth the cost.  First time in 20 years (and over 200 crossings, 20 in Africa) we used fixers.   On Sudanese side, customs didn't want to talk to us and it was hard to find English speaking people. 

Sudan - Mazar +249-122-380-740

Egypt- Jamel +201010899250, 200EP
new number from Kamal
+201100504841

name: Border Sudan to Ethiopia step 1 Security check
description: Small office 50 meters off main road just check passport

name: Basic guesthouse
description: Basic guesthouse, nothing special but the owner has a boat to go to the soleb temple. Paid 200 for a double and 200 for the boat to soleb for 2 persons.(could probably been cheaper if we negotiated)

name: Bush camp
description: Camped behind a little hill close to the road, nobody noticed.

name: Ahmed Mousa hostel
description: Quiet clean hostel for $10 for two people. Call Ahmed Mousa at 0912 585 462 (he was at the museum when we called). We had the whole place for ourselves. Parking only on the quiet street in front of the house.

name: Camel race track
description: You can get to camel race tracks if you turn off the tarmac here and keep heading to the east on dirt tracks, until you will see the gates and tracks, about 10-20 km away from here. The race is on Friday or Saturday (maybe only once in a month?), very early morning - ask in advance when is a race. Abdulsalam of Farbest auto service center might find out for you.

name: Nub Kush Tourist registration and permits
description:
Sudan tour information and Archaeological trips in to the sudan desert. 

Moez Mahir.
+249 912972571
Suq Al Arabi
Said Abd Al Rhman St
West of Oilibya Gas station
Sati Building

name: power station guard house
description:
Small building with solar panals fenced off next to a house
The two guards set up beds for us outside under the stars. They chilled with us and made us some tea in the morning. Great place to stop if you are running out of daylight and need a safe place to sleep.

name: wild camp
description: Rocky outcrop just off the road. Good spot to camp.

name: Ertiah Hotel
description: Nice establishment on the nile river. Rooms are clean and well kept and avalable for 600sp. We spoke to the manager and organised to camp in the parking lot for 250sp (4 people).

name: Rocky Desert
description: Flat patch of rocky desert. Great spot for stargazing and close to a nice restaurant.

name: Koka Ferry
description: Ferry crossing the nile. It has a capacity to transport 4 cars, 3 motorcycles and 6 donkeys. They charge 40sp for a car and 15sp for a motorcycle.

name: Castle
description: Remenence of a stone castle on top of the hill overlooking the nile. Not much left of the castle but the view on top is great.

name: Kerma ruins
description: Old mud hut inhabited by swallows. Not much left of the building.

name: fantastic modern restaurant
description: great restaurant, ac, modern, full menu, super nice and clean.  just opened.  reasonable priced

name: Ethiopia Embassy (correct location)
description:
correct location. google was on other side of cemetery. Great at bunchofbackpackers.com


Get there before opening as they only have limited slots or you will have to come back tomorrow 
come as early as possible but at least before 8 am

name: Old fuel station and truck parking
description:
We found this place safe. A few broken trucks parked here but also transport companies use it as a sleep over. Someone knocked at the door just after dark, we said hello and shook hands ,all good. Tyre repair shop near by.
.

name: Karima market
description: Several eateries and shops on the market, about the only eating option in Karima.

name: Abri petrol station
description: No petrol on the main road but this station had.

name: Kassala Hotel
description: 120 for fan room - shared bathrooms - can bring motorbike into lobby for night

name: Marafy Hotel
description: 150 SDP for fan twin ensuite. 24hr guard and good parking for motorbikes etc. Next to petrol station and very near bus station

name: Rocky hill wild camp
description: Dried river bed in between two rocky hills. Semi out of sight from the road and the hill provides some shelter from the wind.

name: Dried up pond
description: Small dried up pond hidden from the road. nice flat ground for camping. peaceful and quite.

name: Quiet desert camp near Wadi Halfa
description: A good place to stay for one night in the desert. It’s hidden behind some rocks. Just 4 km from Wadi Halfa. Just follow the tracks into the desert, 4x4 necessary.

name: Friday Wrestling Arena
description: Sudanese wrestling Fridays only from 4pm until Sunset - S£ 10 per person, good show !

name: Al-Housh
description: On the Nile, great vibe and food - an instutition !

name: Shisha place and Sports on Tv
description: Shisha is still running besides the ban if you’re looking to watch tv and sports too this is the place !

name: Market - Food & Shisha
description: Best options to eat and kill some time around a Shisha - bus stop to Egypt

name: Sahara Desert wildcamp
description: There are no villages along the road between Karima and Dongola, so you can really camp anywhere. We found some rocky dunes to camp behind. Very windy during the day but the wind died down at nightfall. Totally quiet and gorgeous night sky.

name: Argin
description:
Border Crossing EGYPT - SUDAN
Very good alternative to Wadi Halfa Crossing. 
24 hours open.

name: Ozone
description: Very nice modern western style  place where you can enjoy a selection of pastries, fresh juices, salads, Quiche, ice cream and more. There’s an outdoor seating area as well as an AC regulated inside restaurant. No longer WiFi. Enjoy!

name: Fish Wok/Saj Samak
description:
Super nice local fish restaurant! 
Really well known with locals and expats alike, they only do fish.

name: Wild Camp in the mountains
description: Beautiful secluded place in a dry river bed in the mountains. Nice view and very quiet. Coming from the north is no problem, but we came from the south and ended up driving the wrong way when the (unmarked) road becomes one way for 6.5km, then we turned onto the dirt track. You could potentially do the same as it’s a pretty big road and it seems like many people go the wrong way. But be warned.

name: Road becomes one way street
description: Northbound travelers must turn left here to continue as road becomes one way. Not well marked. We drove 12km into the mountains before we realized and had to turn back when many trucks were heading straight for us. Be careful!

name: Excellent fixer for ferry to Saudi
description:
Hamido is an excellent fixer for the ferry to Jeddah. He speaks good English, was very responsive and professional and everything went smoothly as promised. He even helped us find diesel during the massive shortage. He also does tours and can help with whatever else you might need. Highly recommended. 
‭+249 (0) 91 234 1234‬
hamido_basil@yahoo.com

name: Maks cargo service (Turkish airlines)
description: We airfreight our motorcycles with Turkish Airlines from Khartoum to Istanbul. This is the location office (13). We paid in total 662 usd for 2 motorcycles (excl. costs in İstanbul). For all details we write an article on our website www.oneroadoneworld.com (very detailed).

name: MTN Store
description: There is a good MTN store, you can buy local SIM Card and Data Volume for Internet

name: Tuttifrutti
description: Italian Café with the best ice cream in Khartoum

name: Shopping mall
description: A decent shopping mall with all the goodies you might need. Also in the area is a bunch of other shops that are in the area surrounding the mall

name: Dunlop Zone (workshop and sale)
description: Quit new workshop and sales of Dunlop. The also speak english very well. Did wheel balancing here. They also do oil change, alignment and sell Dunlop tires. Balancing 4 tires was 320S£ so with black market exchange this time 8$.

name: Immigration for ferry to Saudi
description:
For beeing up to date:

Got my ticket for the ferry at one of the many offices in Suakin. The price was 6500Sudan£. That‘s for a Jeep and one person. With the actual black market rate it is about 150$. People in Khartoum and Port Sudan asked for 350$ so better pay in Sudan£. I arrived on saturday and took the ferry on sunday evening. On Sudnay morning I went back to the office for registering my ticket for this day. 

At 2pm I drove up to the port, show your ticket at the gate. After that ride to the customs building just 100m left. They take you carnet and give you some letter in arabic. After that continue straight on the termac road. You will come to another gate, turn left on the dirt road until you come to the next gate. Here you park your car and go for immigration. Three different steps for the exit stamp. At first in the big building straight and after that the small building on the other side of the outdoor hall. Pay 45Sudan£ for some „exit ticket“. After collecting two stamps on the form and the „ticket“ you are ready for the passport stamp inside the big building again. 

After being a stamp collector you can drive your car in the area for boarding ;).

No fixer needed. Police is also speaking english sometimes and friendly.

Be aware that in august and end of july it can be very busy because of Hajj season.

name: Crimson Lights
description: Middle class hotel complex with several buildings, garden, restaurant, secure parking. We paid 80 US dollar for a small but clean double room with bathroom, buffet breakfast included (price in SDG would have been 1300).

name: Aldaman Hotel Nyala
description: Modern, clean business hotel with restaurant. Parking in front of the hotel. We paid 960 SDG for a clean double room with bathroom and breakfast.

name: Almuallem Hotel
description: 300 Pounds the night. Neither clean nor working working toilet.

name: Civil and Passport Registration
description:
Alien registration possible, but takes ages. It took us about 2h and even had to take the police officer for a spin to another station for some more stamps. But in the end everything worked. Was 580 p. P.
Actually copy of passport possible on site (first office after entrance)

name: unknown name petrol station
description: Has Benzine. Finally! There's another one about 6km out in direction to Karima, which has only Diesel

name: Adel Hotel
description: Good, clean hotel but comes at a price. Has WiFi, toilet and shower en-suite. Rate 900-1100. Lots of parking space in front. Bicycles can go in room.

name: Al Abara Hotel
description:
Actually it's probably the nicest place around. Checked the other two places prior to this. Price is ridiculously high (1500 for one night). The parking space is gated. Check rooms before you check-in. Some have no toilet seats, other have no running water. It's ridiculous. It would be so easy to brush this place up.
On the fun side: it was probably the best check in that took me the longest time ever.

name: Al Marfa Hotel
description: Nice double rooms with shower, kettle, AC and fan in the room. Restaurant also on site. Paid 400 sudanese pounds per night. Enormous rooms with two bedrooms 550 Sudanese pounds per night. parking in front on the street but there is a guard and cameras

name: Wildcamp in borrowpit
description: Quite place located in an abandoned borrow pit approx. 200 m from the road. Access road and site on firm ground. Can be accessed during rains.

name: Desert wildcamp
description:
Beautiful place in the middle of nowhere. No people, no water, no facilities. Nothing but hills, sand and rocks. And bugs.
Reachable probably only with a 4x4 vehicle as the track towards it is sometimes deep sand.
We spend a wonderful, quiet night here.

name: Restaurant at the Blue Nile (name unknown)
description: Very good food in a fantastic setting looking over the Blue Nile. Prices are not bad at all and service is very good. We had to point to other table to choose our food where the menu was completely in Arabic, but there's always very nice Sudanese people around who want to help you with the translation :) There's no parking for cars though. We had the chance of parking our motorbikes inside at the entrance.

name: Local fish restaurant
description: Very good fish restaurant with unique atmosphere.

name: Falafel bar
description: very good falafel place in town. a nice spot to relax and watch the streetlife.

name: BBQ Chicken (Sign is in Arabic)
description:
This is a great BBQ chicken shop that is on the left-hand side as you’re driving into Dongola’s main road. It has a red sign with yellow writing in Arabic (see photo).

It cost us SDG120 (USD7) for a whole chicken stuffed with garlic rice that comes with bread and a spicy, hot pepper sauce. It can easily be shared between two. There’s a place to the left of the restaurant where you can wash your hands. If you need the toilet there’s one to the left of the hand-washing station, but you have to go through some gates into what looks like a school courtyard with benches. Head to the right and there’s a very simple toilet in the corner.

name: (Scam) checkpoint
description: Guard wanted SDG 2,500 for some form of ticket. On asking for a receipt with his name on it, he went to the hut, spoke very briefly to someone, and then waved us through. DON'T PAY ANYTHING!

name: Electricity mast, hidden place
description:
Nice place 50 kilometers before the border. 
There is a dirt road on your right hand, go in, under the electricity mast there is a road to the left follow and you find a nice sheltered place.

name: APSCO
description: We got diesel here. One of the few places between Wadi Halfa and Khartoum. Very long queue. Went directly to the office and had a little help of a friend

name: Speed limited
description: Warming, they controle your speed here (60???). Even if you don’t drive to fast they will say you drive too fast. You have to pay $170 sdp.

name: Desert camp
description: Just of the road behind a dune. No people, no bugs, just you and the stars.

name: Diesel station
description: Diesel station near Delgo, coming from Wadi Halfa it’s after a police checkpoint to the right. It looks deserted but there was somebody there! And no line!

name: Diesel station
description: This place had diesel, they only wanted to tank jerrycans.

name: Diesel station
description: Diesel station. Huge line, but some friendly people told us that we could skip the line. Ask around, otherwise you could be stuck all day.

name: Police Station
description: Not the best place for camp but that's ok for rest the night in a safety place. Policemen are nice but don't speak english

name: Nubian Desert behind an adobe wall
description: Wild camping in the Nubian Desert behind an adobe wall. Nice spot in the Desert not far from the main road. Save from wind

name: Nubian's Desert
description: Camping behind dunes, near the road but not at the main view

name: Bush camp
description: Half way Naqa temple, between the trees. Beautiful setting. BUT our cover of the rooftop tent got stolen at night. It was the only thing we left outside the car. We saw a couple of farmers during the day and some lights at night so some must have come back to roam around while we slept.

name: Diesel station
description: This place has diesel. Huge line, ask for help.

name: Beneath the road
description: The road passes over a dry river bed. Easy to get down to, out of sight. Good place if travelling with bicycle.

name: Hotel al-Nasr
description: Clean room with private western toilet, 300 SDG. Two bicycles easily fit inside after removing one of the four beds. The beds are cafeteria style, but with mattress. Quiet. Very friendly people. You have to visit the security police (مركز الامن) yourself for registration at 18.542034, 31.843348

name: lookout over wohle pyramids
description: here you have the best view of all pyramids, perfect for sunset and sunrise! you can camp at the bottom of the hill and climb it for superb views

name: Lord Hotel
description: Basic guesthouse. 150 SDG per night for room with private bathroom (no western toilet, cold water only), cleaning.

name: diesel gas station, long cue because at this moment the only whit diesel
description: diesel gas station, a local brought us here because no other petrol station had diesel

name: tombs of el kuru
description:
you can see two tombs, one with we'll preserved painting, in the other you see an altar but no colorful paintings, 

10 dollar or 300 pounds for 2 person

name: nuri pyramids
description:
a couple of pyramids, some well maintained others not,
you are the only person on this world heritage site 
we paid 200 pounds for 2 
you can bargain about the price 
nice here to do funny pictures with the pyramids 😀

name: Embassy of Djibuti
description:
visa for djibouti!
next possibility is Addis far away from border crossing etiopia to djibouti! so if you want to go get your visa here

name: steel worker
description:
can do metal welding! very nice people that can not speak english! 

tarek was again our translater who also helped us with the mechanics BLANCO , 
if you have trouble come here, honest and friendly people 

tarek telephone number:
0912158333
(see also mechanic landrover, tarek knows a lot of people who are able to help you with any problem of your vehicle, when he is not picking up just tell that they should call tarek, he lives in an outskirt in omdourmani and may be it takes a little bit of time, but waiting is worth because he speaks english well and can translate and will definitely be able to help you!!! 
even when he is not answering the phone try to go to the mechanic blanco or this place and they will call him!)

name: Wild camp between the trees
description: A nice wild camp between thorn trees, not far from security checkpoint. Asked there if we could camp in this bush, they said no problem. Nobody disturbed us.

name: Delgo Hospital
description:
Ask for the Delgo Hospital. I was trying to find a place to sleep in Delgo, when I came across the hospital. I asked to a doctor if I could pitch my tent, and I was offered to sleep in the unused (?) mosque of the hospital, instead. 
The room has electricity. 
The toilet I could go to was far from being clean, and had no door.

name: The Nile Hotel
description:
Small hotel with four? rooms. The hotel opened in July 2018. The rooms and the bedding are clean. Asked price is 100 pp/night. You end up paying 200 if you take a room for yourself. The rooms aren't big, but you can store your bicycle in the room if you want to. 

The shower only has cold water. 

Finding the hotel isn't easy as you have to first enter a gate  between two buildings, before  accessing to the entrance of the hotel. 

The hotel is next to the bank and opposite the ferry and a small fruit market.

name: Gasstation with green banner, sign is in arabic
description:
This gasstation has diesel and petrol, we are travelling on two bikes and the locals where really friendly letting us skip the line. 

A few km before we got offered petrol from the black market by a rate of 100sdg per litre, which we refused. At this gasstation you can get 1l = 6,45sdg.

name: Besides Wadi Halfa
description: Beautiful wildcamp spot behind a hill off the main highway. Take the track off leading into the desert and turn left after the first rocky hill tracking around until you are in the sandy part. Hidden from the road, but you can still hear it.

name: Petrol station - diesel, no benzine
description: Long lines for the diesel and even though we were told there was supposed to be benzine here we were unlucky.

name: Petrol
description: Long queue. It means that there is a petrol like yesterday. Sometimes gasoline is long queue and diesel is without. Just ask around and try.

name: Camp under the trees
description: Wild camp in a dry river next to a couple of trees. You can see the road but probably nobody see you. High mountains around. And what is important it's not so hot in here. Very nice for camp.

name: bush camp
description: very nice place for camping next to the lake. Go further in the lake direction and you will find nice places fir camping. Close to the village but very friendly people. In the morning they come to the lake with their cows so early wake up :)

name: Border Sudan-Ethiopia customs step 2
description: after checking passport you need to come here to do the customs exit with your CDP (triptik). quick check of number of the car, form no 25 which you got in the entrance to Sudan and you get your stamp. Then go to immigration which is around 60 m further in Ethiopiam direction, last building.

name: Border Sudan to Ethiopia step 3
description: Immigration office. You need to fill up the form and you get your exit stamp. Now you're free to go to Ethiopia.

name: check point
description: just passport control, asking about gun, easy

name: Nile petroleum
description: We were able to find petrol at this station, long lines off course but there is a separate line for motorcycles so we were able to skip most of it and be finished in 10 minutes. No diesel.

name: Local Sudanese Ful Restaurant
description: Really good local resraurant with excellent ful and good prices. It is located on the other side of the street from the Blue Nile Sailing Club, oposite of the chicken fast food place. Priceys are pretty cheap. ~50sdg per person.

name: Official Toyota Service & Sales
description:
The official Toyota service and sales center in Khartoum. Opening hours: 07:30-15:30. No reservation is needed, just roll in as early as possible. Starting to be more people at 9:00. 

Park in the parking spots outside, go into the office and state your business, the representative will then tell the guards to open the gate for you to drive in.

name: Camp behind dunes
description:
Hidden behind the dunes. As it’s close to Khartoum there are more people around than further out in the desert. However, we hid behind dunes and no one came anywhere close or could even been seen. 

Nice solid surface to camp on and a quite easy path from the main road. 

Can get a bit windy as the desert is really flat.

name: Camp behind dunes
description:
One of few places with some dunes to hide behind on a long stretch of very flat landscape. 

Even if looks like desert, this is actually farmland and there are irrigation systems to water the crops. You may hear noise from pumps/generators from a far. If you’re elevated (e.g have a roof top tent) you may be seen from a distance. 

When breaking up camp and going out to the main road again, we met the owner of the land, a super friendly guy and if we’d met him before setting up camp we probably would have end up in his house for the night. 

There’s a sand access road leading almost all the way up to the campsite. The road has a few patches of soft sand, so make sure you’ve sufficient speed and air down if you’re heavily loaded.

name: Alneel hôtel
description: Very Cheap place, dormitory for 30 Sudanese pounds. Cold shower.

name: Ruins camp
description: If it s windy, the place it’s good with ruins

name: Hôtel in Atbara
description:
Clean room with A/C for 300 Sdp
Nice staff

name: Diesel station
description: Had diesel at Jan 4th 2019. No line early in the morning

name: Cheap hotel
description:
Cheap place to stay. 


Bike in room. I payed 200 Sdp for 1 room with 2 beds ( I m alone, maybe price little bit different if you r 2)

It s not easy to find because nothing write. It s small door in front of Kak restaurant .

name: Sudanese Customs Office
description:
If you are late or they need time to stamp the carnet and it's dark now, they allow you to camp in the yard of the customs
office. All officials are very friendly. There are restaurants around.

name: Riverbank of the Blue Nile
description: Leave the main road at the checkpoint north of Wad Madani and follow  the track to the Nile. You will find nice places without dust, directly at the steep slope, with an amazing view over the Nile. Some  people passed, just friendly greeting, nobody disturbs us. Sunrise above the water...

name: Gas Filling Station
description: The first Filling Station with gas available since Ethiopian Border! 100 SP for 5kg

name: MAN Workshop
description: Very friendly stuff, helped us immediately. Workshop will change 2020 to a new place.

name: Rafa Travel & Tourism Agency
description: Here we booked the ferry from Suakin to Jiddah. Price was 14.500 SP for our truck and 4.000 SP per person.

name: Border post
description: After crossing from Ethiopia to Sudan it was late afternoon we camped at the border in a big parking lot very quite & peaceful & obviously very safe with the guards .

name: MTN shop
description:
MTN shop for SIM card & data 
Helpful & efficient 
Spoke a little English

name: Afra Mall
description:
Afra Shopping Mall  Khartoum good supermarket with lots of essentials, good butcher & deli reasonably priced. Also a few coffee shops, MTN shop & cinema.
Good parking available

name: Sanabil Diesel
description:
Diesel available  long queues here in Karima 
The security guard let us get to the front of the  long queue , all smooth & orderly 
5.12 pounds per litre !

name: Argeen Border Land port
description:
Argeen Land Port crossing from Sudan to Egypt ( west side of Nile from Dongola) 
SUDAN EXIT :-

Passport Stamp 50 Sudanese pound pp
Carnet Stamp  203 Sudanese pound 
Ministry of Departure 50 Sudanese pound pp
Ministry of Departure 150 Sudanese pound for the car ( Landrover)

All charges above receipted 

Fixers can assist which we don’t normally use  however it made it an easier process as no English is spoken. It took 3 hours with the fixer . Paid 350 Sudanese pound but we think it was worth it , it would have been a much longer process without him.

Car searched thoroughly before departure to Egyptian side 

Be patient it all takes time closed between 12 noon to 1 pm ( call to pray) 

EGYPT ENTRY:- 

Following documents checked on arrival 

Passports
Carnet 
Insurance certificate 
Drivers License 
Visa( we already got at the Consulate in Khartoum)
Yellow fever certificate
Fill out a couple of forms 

Banks at the border change US & Euro to Egyptian dollar (  they do not except or change any Sudanese pounds here) Also limited hours opening. 

They will photocopy what they need 
Paid  945 Egyptian pounds for various stamps, customs etc
220 Egyptian pounds for the Egyptian number plates ( this process took some time lots of paperwork and backward & forwards to various offices)
180 Egyptian pounds for car insurance 
150 Egyptian pounds to exit / car search 

Car very thoroughly checked 
The whole process took about  5 hours 
Lots of confusion,frustration and quite tiresome but we eventually enter Egypt.

name: Musawwarat Es Sufra Site
description: Big site, fenced and guy that showed up said $20 USD per person, then came down to 500sp for three people. He's just making it up.

name: Rocky Desert Wild
description:
Could not find anything on the river that was not farmed or densely populated.
Followed good tire tracks to this small canyon to shelter from relentless wind, which did stop overnight but started again at 8 am.
Locals are back here getting gravel, but I didn't see anyone or any vehicles.
Great view of big mountain.

name: Petrol here
description: Station behind. Lots of Petrol, no line, easy. No diesel at time.

name: Continental hotel
description:
An old colonial hotel close to the Nile.
500 for a double with working AC, fridge, plugs, cold shower and OK European style toilet

Selling point is the whole vibe of this hotel. It has a nice beautiful garden and a restaurant in the front which sells Shwoarma, fish sandwiches, chicken..
Also fresh juice available and within reach of the hotels Wifi

name: Greek Club
description: Nice place to rest. Many (only) expats. Quite western style. There is a swimming pool, soccer and basket. Quite cheap. Nice on Friday.

name: Karima's pyramids
description: A must to see if you are around. Nice pyramids next to the road. Free. 10minutes it's enough. Good spot to take some pics with your vehicle too and pyramids.

name: Mohamed restaurant
description:
I stoped here to eat something and I met the owner, Mohamed, 25years old, graduated in karthoun, he speaks good English. Very nice guy, he offered me even to sleep. Good option to stay for one night.

Vespanda Ilario Lavarra

name: Dismissed small house
description:
Good for cyclist to spend the night. 

Vespanda Ilario Lavarra

name: Comesa Yellow card - Shiekan insurance
description:
At this office we got our Comesa yellow card for car insurance. 
We paid SDP2800 (about €53/$60) for 3 months, 2 people and 1 Land Cruiser, from here to down south. The number of countries influences the amount you pay. 
The insurance manager told us that there are several companies in Khartoum offering the Yellow Card, this is the only one we found. 

The Shiekan office has several entrances, we took the right one (see photo). Ask for Mr Ahmed Hassan, manager of Yellow Card.

Helpful, friendly staff. English speaking (managers). Took us about 2 hours in total.

name: Wild camp in dry pond
description: Dry pond, out of sight of the road. Just 100 from the main road.

name: Tyre Repair
description:
MAN Khartoum recommend this place.
Repaired serious puncture to Michelin XLX. Excellent job, 1600 Sudan Pounds.

name: Petrified Forest
description: Worth to see and you can camp in the desert.

name: Hotel Red Sea Resort
description: Very peaceful place, they offer a campground for USD 10 per person, using toilet and shower. Diving Center, electricity availabel

name: Luxor Laundry
description: Wash all clothes, no underwear. Very quicklebendig cost doubble Price.

name: park
description: free camping. there are shadows, many trees, goats and monkeys

name: Cold drinks
description: Cold drinks. Enough said. Have a rest.  Cheers!

name: Bush camp
description: Following the only path/road you see on your right on the main road and you will arrive here. Relatively out of sight. Watch of for thorns. Probably only for people travelling by bicycle for other vehicles the path might be too narrow or you will be visible but you could go deeper. MTN E signal.

name: Bush camp
description:
Quiet bush camp. A little close to the road but at night no traffic. 
There is a double track that leads to a field I used that to enter and then pick a spot. The land is very dry and with lots of cracks but there are a few even places.

name: Off by 1km
description: It’s one km down the road. Plenty of food choices (fast food) and cold drinks.

name: Wad Morah Cafeteria
description: Big cafeteria with little store. Only a couple of beds available. Lots of tables and seats.

name: Several shops and cafeterias
description: Lots of cafeterias with seats and beds. Food and cold drinks.

name: Small cafeteria with small shop
description:
Usual cafeteria. Got here in the dark not sure there is something better around. They had no cold drinks. 
Usual food. Lots of beds.

name: Roadside Refreshments
description: Few cafeteria and shops. Cold drinks and food available.

name: Adobe walls
description: Here you can pitch your tent sheltered from the desert’s winds. Also while being close to the road you won’t be seen.

name: food and cots
description:
Food and drinks available although not cold. 
Few beds.

name: food and cots
description: Usual Cafeterias and cots. Very cold (iced) drinks in the shop towards the end (towards Khartoum). If you wanna spend the night on one of usual bed the best a quite place is past all the cafeterias another 50/100 on the left there is a cafeteria very quiet. No cold drinks here tho.

name: Big Cafeteria
description:
Big cafeteria. Lots of food and plenty of cold drinks. Lots of bed available if you wanna spend the night.
It’s one of the bus stops.

name: Big cafeteria
description:
Big cafeteria where bus stops for a break. Exposed to wind and dust. 
Possibly there are better options on the other side of the road. 
Lots of beds available. 
Lesser known local soft drinks available. IE Sudan Cola

name: Cafeteria
description:
Nice place. Unfortunately no cold drinks.
You could arrive here in the dark and spend the night. A few beds available. Large courtyard to camp too.

name: Cafetería
description: Cafeteria. Cold drinks. Bed available. If you arrive lTe and it looks all closed go to the far end there is a little garden and that’s where the keepers put his bed.

name: Road side cafeteria
description:
Road side cafeteria with little mosque next to it and petrol station. 
Food and cold drinks available. I’m sure there are beds around but I was here in the afternoon and only saw a couple of ones. I’d be surprised they don’t have more available stored somewhere.

name: Cafeteria
description: Roadside cafeteria. Beds available. They have a generator so sometimes cold drinks depending how lucky you are.

name: Cafeteria
description:
Road side cafeteria.
Cold drinks (maybe because of the generator on during the evening. 
Food available plenty of space to spend the night. Beds should be available but can’t confirm as I stopped to rest and have some food.

name: Cafeteria
description: Roadside cafeteria with food and cold drinks. Beds available. Convenient store.  There is another place a little further if you’re heading north or a little before if you’re heading south.

name: Cafeteria
description:
Roadside cafeteria with shop. 
Food available and beds. The shop has frozen like drinks!

name: Cafeteria
description:
There are two cafeteria. This one is the first on if you’re heading north or the second one if you’re heading south. 
Run by a sweet gentleman who can’t speak properly for some conditions and his wife and daughters. It’s the first time I see a cafeteria run by women. 
Food available, beds but sadly limited choice of cold drinks when I got here in the middles of a sand storm.

name: Cafetería
description:
Roads side cafeteria. 
Food and cold drinks available. 
Lots of beds.

name: Cafeterias
description: Lot of Cafeterias. Food, cold drinks and beds. Several convenient stores too.

name: Cafeteria
description:
Roadside cafeteria. 
Food and cold drinks available. 
Convenient store. 
Beds and matted floor space available.

name: Meroe Pyramids Wild Camp
description: Behind a dune next to a small tree behind the pyramids and out of sight.  No one to bother you and perfect spot for the night.  In bye morning a very polite camel rider allowed us a ride and pics for 200 sp and a vendor arrived on a donkey selling various souvenirs but not pushy at all.

name: Behind dunes
description: 200 km before Argeen Border to Egypt.  Off the main road a few hundred metres. Hidden from sight and perfect stopover

name: Nubian Guesthouse Camping
description:
Good place to stay next to the Nile. (You can go for a swim there) The owner is a very friendly and helpful guy. He can help you with mechanics and people in town. 
Toilet and shower clean but basic. We were aloud to camp in front of the guest house.

name: Mecca
description: Clean rooms with western toilet, shower, fan and air conditioning, and WIFI

name: New turn off for Naqa Temple.
description: This is a new road into the temple. Good tar road for most of the way makes it a quick trip in.

name: Rocky outcrop
description: About 200 metres off the road behind a rocky outcrop. It was very quiet and no one around for miles.

name: Kangan Hotel
description: A big hotel which was quite busy. 300SP per night for two people in a room with two beds and a shower and toilet. Fairly clean and reasonably comfortable. There is no food served here so you have to go up into the town.

name: Half moon hotel
description:
New and clean hotel. Single 350 Sudan pounds (5USD) , double / twin 500. With good AC and fridge, TV, slow Wifi. Nice location.  
We are traveling by bike. They keep our bikes in the safe place near the reception.

name: kerma museum and main Dufofa
description:
main Dufofa (old temple)
surprisingly nice museum with great statues of the black pharaohs. a 20mn movie explains many things about the place.
they asked 15$ for entrance fee for our family (we have 3 children), we paid 400SP to encourage preservation of their heritage.

name: Best Foul
description: Really good food, fresh bread and falafels

name: Atbara-Karima crossing
description: Many food places, cold drinks and groceries

name: Dodi
description: The shwarma I ordered at this restaurant is the single best meal I’ve had in 6 months of traveling from Cape Town to Sudan

name: Ruins
description: Stoned ruins in case of windy weather. 50 meters from road

name: Chai stop
description: Little family, they make chai and I guess some food.

name: Quiet bush camp close to Migre village
description:
Wide flat area with bushes and rocks to hide from the road. Easy access.

Convenient stop for cyclists coming from Al Qadarif and going to Al Fao. There’s a small village about 4 km East where you can stop to have dinner and stock up with water and biscuits.

I met a young shepherd while trying to find a place to pitch my tent. He was very polite and helpful (big thing coming from Ethiopia) and recommended me to go behind the rocks to get away from the wind and the traffic noise. I had a very calm and pleasant night under the stars, the first one since Kenya.

name: Camping in a Gas Station
description:
It was night and a couple of truck drivers were sleeping on their cots next to their vehicles. I pulled over with my bicycle and asked the security guy if I could pitch my tent. He said yes, but insisted on giving me one of those cots Sudanese people love and I ended up sleeping on it under the big roof. 

A little noisy because of the road but not too bad. Nice breeze coming from the river.

name: Bicycle Mechanics and Spare Parts
description: Many bicycle mechanics and little shops. Ask for Adam, he’s very good and don’t cheat.

name: Falafels
description: Good English speaking falafel guy, from Egypt.

name: Many food places
description: Lots of food places and trucks stopping.
